TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants ' house in the village of GPE ( GPE ) was destroyed by an explosion .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants brought an action for damages against GPE in ORG ( PERSON ) .
A hearing was held on DATE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicants asked the court to request ORG FAC uprava ORG ) to submit their report concerning the events that had led to the destruction of the applicants ' property . On DATE the court requested the report .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP parliament introduced an amendment to LAW which provided that all proceedings concerning actions in respect of damage resulting from terrorist acts were to be stayed pending the enactment of new legislation on the subject and that before the enactment of such new legislation damages for terrorist acts could not be sought . So far , the NORP authorities have not enacted any new legislation regulating the matter .
CARDINAL . It appears that several constitutional claims were lodged , though not by the applicants in the present case , challenging the above legislation . ORG has not yet reached any decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings in accordance with the above legislation . No appeal was lodged against that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants ' garage and the adjacent storage room and a meat - curing shed in Bjelovar were destroyed , also as a result of an explosion .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants brought an action for damages against GPE in ORG .

CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW ( Zakon o obveznim odnosima ) reads as follows :

“ Responsibility for loss caused by death or bodily injury or by damage or destruction of another 's property , when it results from violent acts or terror or from public demonstrations or manifestations , lies with the ... authority whose officers were under a duty , according to the laws in force , to prevent such loss . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of the LAW amending LAW ( Zakon o izmjenama i dopunama PERSON o obveznim odnosima – Official Gazette no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) read as follows :
“ Section CARDINAL of LAW ( Official Gazette nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE ) is repealed . ”
“ Proceedings for damages instituted under LAW shall be stayed .
The proceedings referred to in the first paragraph of this section shall be continued after the enactment of special legislation governing responsibility for damage resulting from terrorist acts . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW provides :
“ Proceedings shall be stayed :
( CARDINAL ) where another statute so prescribes . ”
